questions.answer_description: We need to flush the DNS to have the new IP address assigned to the same computer name. Use the ipconfig/flushdns command.

comments.content: Yes you are right! all we should type on Computer B is " ipconfig /flushdns" and press enter to flush the local DNS cache and then type "ping Computer A " and press enter just to verify.

discussion.content: Couldn't you just use ipconfig /flushdns then ping? I thought renew and release was just for DHCP issues.
IPCONFIG /release and IPCONFIG /renew are for resolving DHCP related issue, but this is only related to DNS issue so just IPCONFIG /flushdns should resolve the issue.

COMPUTER A:
-The user successfully used the `ping` command to check the connectivity to the IP address 10.10.10.30. The results show that the packets sent received a reply without any loss, indicating good connectivity.
-The user attempts to use the `nslookup` command but fails because improper syntax.

COMPUTER B: 
-Computer B pings 10.10.10.20, the successful ping response means that Computer B can reach Computer A. This confirms network connectivity between the two machines. 
-nslookup attempts: syntax error. Proper usage would look something like `nslookup computerA` or `nslookup 10.10.10.20` to check the current DNS entry for ComputerA or to verify the hostname for the new IP address.

To solve the issue: 
At the command prompt from computer B, type `ipconfig /flushdns` and press `Enter` . This command clears the local DNS cache, which might contain outdated or incorrect entries that are causing issues with DNS resolution, especially after changes like an IP address update on Computer A.
Has anyone noticed that ping address for Computer A is 10.10.10.10? shouldn't this 0.10.10.20 instead? To see if there is a good connection
I second the comments on here. This is just a DNS (Domain Name System) issue. /renew and /release are for DHCP
necesitamos vaciar la cache dns para que se asigne una nueva dirección ip al nombre de pc

Computer A is on IP 10.10.10.20 Computer B is on 10.10.10.30, the initial picturess show they can successfully ping each other so IP isn't the problem. All that is needed is ipconfig /flushdns to remove any locally chached dns results then ping ComputerA to confirm it's now picking up the correct address.

comments.content: Would you not release and then renew?

discussion.content:
Use 
ipconfig /renew
ipconfig /release
ipconfig /flushdns
on Computer B

There are a variety of situations where flushing the DNS is helpful. Think of the DNS cache as a list of addresses you frequent and an important tool for having a fast and healthy internet connection. This cache can be corrupted by a variety of factors (Including virus issues). Flushing it is similar to resetting RAM, it forgets everything and starts fresh. On a network with tons of DNS issues, this is a quick possible solution. DNS knowledge is very important for understanding networking, take sometime and make it second-nature. Also memorize key DNS numbers (For your job). They sometimes have appeared on CompTIA style exams but it's also really useful for testing. DNS servers like 8.8.8.8 (Public Google) allow you to test different combinations, go around ISP restrictions, and even access restricted content. It's important to understand why DNS routing is a useful tool.

questions.question_text:
An end user has signed up to use a web-based calendar application.
Which of the following solutions has the user purchased?

discussion.content:
Correct answer is B) SaaS
From the official CompTIA study guide:
IaaS - Infrastructure as a Service requires the most network management expertise from a client. In an IaaS setup, the client provides and manages the software. It's used when the client doesn't have the money to buy more network hardware.
PaaS - Platform as a Service adds a layer to IaaS that includes software development tools such as runtime environments. The vendor manages the various hardware platforms.
SaaS - Software as a Service is the highest of these three levels. It handles the task of managing software and its deployment, and includes the platform and infrastructure as well. Examples are Google Docs, Microsoft Office 365 and Dropbox.
Because people use SaaS web platform such as Google, Microsoft Outlook on everyday basis
Answer is B ) saas
Yes B, SaaS - Soft as a Service.
SaaS is a software based-applications services,,

questions.question_text: A thin client in a VDI environment receives the OS by connecting to the network through a number of devices. Which of the following is FIRST in the chain?

discussion.content: Ask more questions to find out if other devices on the network is also having internet connectivity issues or if it's just your own device...

Step one of COMPTIA troubleshooting. Identifying the Problem. We will encounter a lot of this problems along the journey, it can be very subtle at some situations and its best to familiarize the procedures.

choices.D: Ask questions and use available tools to clarify the issue
choices.B: Have the user perform a hard shutdown and a cold boot
choices.A: Document possible reasons why the Internet is no longer working
choices.C: Instruct the user to disconnect the Ethernet cable for 30 seconds

questions.question_text: A user contacts the help desk to report the Internet is not working. Which of the following steps should the technician take NEXT?
A SOHO wireless network must be configured to allow IoT devices on the network. Which of the following settings MOST likely needs to be configured?

discussion.content: If you have to "allow" an IOT device on a network, it needs to connect to the network. Assuming it's a standard 802.11 wireless network, like connecting a refrigerator or maybe a camera, one of the things you must configure is the passphrase to log onto a network. Port forwarding is something that may be automatically done through UPNP or manually if you want remote access to devices but the vast majority of devices may not be accessed from outside of a local network. The question doesn't even address that. It seems to just address getting the devices On the local network.
